Package proj

Class Bicycle

java.lang.Object
proj.Vehicle
proj.Bicycle
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Bicycle extends Vehicle
Represents a standard bicycle, a type of non-electric vehicle. This class extends Vehicle and includes properties specific to bicycles, such as whether it is designed for one or two riders.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Bicycle

      public Bicycle(String identifier, String location, boolean forTwo)
      Constructs a new Bicycle with a unique identifier, location, and capacity.
      Parameters:
      identifier - The unique identifier for the bicycle.
      location - The current GPS location of the bicycle.
      forTwo - true if the bicycle is for two people, false otherwise.

  • Method Details

    • setForTwo

      public void setForTwo(boolean forTwo)
      Sets whether the bicycle is designed for two people.
      Parameters:
      forTwo - True for two people, false for one.

    • isForTwo

      public boolean isForTwo()
      Checks if the bicycle is designed for two people.
      Returns:
      True if the bicycle is for two people.

    • getHourlyRate

      public double getHourlyRate(User user)
      Calculates the hourly rental rate for this bicycle based on the user's profile. This method implements the second part of a double dispatch pattern, where the User object determines the final price based on its type (e.g., Student, Worker).
      Overrides:
      getHourlyRate in class Vehicle
      Parameters:
      user - The User who is renting the bicycle.
      Returns:
      The hourly rental rate for the bicycle, specific to the given user.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the Bicycle.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Vehicle
      Returns:
      A string detailing the bicycle's capacity and basic info.
